main event: A huge object resembling a blow torch was sighted traveling low over Petersburg, Indiana on June 3, 1956.
interesting points: The object was reported to have no color and emitted no noise while flying at approximately 500 feet., The sighting was made around the same time as multiple reports of low flying aircraft in the area., Witnesses initially thought it was a meteor but later described it as looking like an aircraft on fire., The object was observed traveling from south to north and later appeared to break apart., All observations pointed towards the object being a meteor or other astronomical phenomenon.
sighted object: a huge object resembling a blow torch
witness description: Civilian observers reported various observations, including a low flying aircraft.
